meanings.definition: The act of replacing one thing with another.
meanings.sent1: In cooking, you can make substitutions if you don't have all the ingredients.
meanings.sent2: She made substitutions in her outfit to match the dress code.
meanings.sent3: The substitutions of the lead actor in the play caused quite a stir among the audience.
meanings.sent4: His sudden substitutions in the team lineup surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's explanation of substitutions using colored blocks made it easier to understand.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that takes the place of another.
meanings.sent1: The substitute teacher is a key example of substitutions in schools.
meanings.sent2: The backup goalkeeper was ready to make substitutions if needed.
meanings.sent3: The robot was designed as a funny substitution for a pet.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a warm substitution for words of thanks.
meanings.sent5: The temporary closure of the road required traffic substitutions to be put in place.

meanings.definition: The action of substituting one person or thing for another.
meanings.sent1: The substitutions made in the team's strategy turned the game around.
meanings.sent2: The substitutions of the damaged parts with new ones improved the machine's performance.
meanings.sent3: The magician's act involved quick substitutions of objects to confuse the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to move to a new city was a bold substitution for her old routine.
meanings.sent5: The substitutions of the old furniture with modern pieces transformed the room completely.
